title: file extension
extract: A file extension (or simply "extension") is the suffix at the end of a filename that indicates what type of file it is. For example, in the filename "myreport.txt," the .TXT is the file extension. It indicates the file is a text document. ... Sometimes long file extensions are used to more clearly identify the file type.Nov 5, 2012
